channel.title: I need help with compiling, PLEASE!
channel.description:
[EDITED] [size=10pt]BTW THE CLASS PATH IS MY PROBLEM NOT THE JAVA VARIABLE![/size] [size=10pt]HELP PLEASE![/size] Hey guys I'm having trouble with getting a compiler to work, everytime I try it says 'javac' is not recognized as internal or external command, and yes I went through the tuts and I could get my environmental variables to work. I really need this to work its not letting me compile any of my changes to sources of Runescape Servers. I first tried setting my paths in the environmental variables.
Then I tried setting my paths in the command prompt. In command prompt I did this. 1) Open Command Prompt 2) I entered: set path-C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_11\bin 3) I pressed enter then wrote in: echo %path% 4) I pressed enter then wrote in: javac HelloWorldApp.java 5) Came up with the error again.
If your not that clear with what I did, please look up the video I placed in youtube, I tried to make it as clear as possible. [url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wfFf9uHYCNA]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wfFf9uHYCNA[/url] Thanks for your time, it would be nice for a solution.

item.title: I need help with compiling, PLEASE!
item.dc:creator: @guardiansg9 guardiansg9
item.description:
@guardiansg9 wrote:

Ok, I just tried it right now but changing my paths to

C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_11\bin

Yet still, I been having no luck. Incase you wanted to know I set my environmental variable path to

C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_11\bin

and my environmental variable class path to

C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_11\bin; %CLASSPATH%

Do you see any mistakes, or errors???
Here is what I then tried to do and came out with.

[code]C:\Documents and Settings\Brennan>java -classpath C:\Documents and Settings\Bren
nan\Desktop\jdk1.6.0_11\bin
Exception in thread “main” java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: and
Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: and
at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(Unknown Source)
at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(Unknown Source)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClassInternal(Unknown Source)
Could not find the main class: and. Program will exit.

C:\Documents and Settings\Brennan>javac HelloWorldApp.java
Error occurred during initialization of VM
java/lang/NoClassDefFoundError: java/lang/Object[/code][br][br][size=1]Posted on: January 31, 2009, 11:49:04 pm[/size][hr]PLEASE HELP I REALLY NEED IT!!! I KNOW I’M DOING SOMETHING WRONG BUT I JUST CAN’T SEE IT!

Read full topic

item.title: I need help with compiling, PLEASE!
item.dc:creator: @guardiansg9 guardiansg9
item.description:
@guardiansg9 wrote:

[EDITED]
[size=10pt]BTW THE CLASS PATH IS MY PROBLEM NOT THE JAVA VARIABLE![/size]
[size=10pt]HELP PLEASE![/size]
Hey guys I’m having trouble with getting a compiler to work, everytime I try it says ‘javac’ is not recognized as internal or external command, and yes I went through the tuts and I could get my environmental variables to work. I really need this to work its not letting me compile any of my changes to sources of Runescape Servers.
I first tried setting my paths in the environmental variables.

Then I tried setting my paths in the command prompt. In command prompt I did this.

  1. Open Command Prompt
  2. I entered: set path-C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_11\bin
  3. I pressed enter then wrote in: echo %path%
  4. I pressed enter then wrote in: javac HelloWorldApp.java
  5. Came up with the error again.

If your not that clear with what I did, please look up the video I placed in youtube, I tried to make it as clear as possible.
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wfFf9uHYCNA
Thanks for your time, it would be nice for a solution.

Read full topic
